page.title: 05TRADE -BILLET ST. SHOPS
page.content: In 1983 Taunton's first new shopping precinct, the Old Market Centre was built. In 1985 after a delay of more than 10 years another large shopping centre was started in the Billet St. area at a cost of Â£11m. The site is owned by the Sun Life Assurance Co. Stores are being built for Sainsburys(45,000 sq.ft.), C & A(11,000 sq.ft.), House of Holland(4,000 sq.ft.), a drugstore and 12 other smaller shops. It is estimated that will create about 300 new jobs.There will be car parking in the centre for 330 cars Already people shop in Taunton from a wide area and survays show that they come from as far as Bristol and Exeter.The new shopping centre will bring even more people in and will become a tourist attraction.
